thread.title: UCLA great Meyers succumbs to cancer
thread.title_full: UCLA great Meyers succumbs to cancer

title: UCLA great Meyers succumbs to cancer
text:
UCLA great Meyers succumbs to cancer Helped Bruins to 1975 championship UPDATED 3:28 AM EDT Oct 11, 2015 Photos Jason Antony/SXC 
Dave Meyers, who helped lead UCLA to the 1975 NCAA basketball championship in coach John Wooden's final season, died Friday at 62 after a battle with cancer. 
Meyers, who was drafted by the Los Angeles Lakers and also played for the Milwaukee Bucks in the NBA, died at his home in Temecula, according to UCLA. 
Meyers is survived by his wife, Linda, daughter Crystal and son Sean. Recommended Comments The views expressed are not those of this site, this station or its affiliated companies. The Clinton campaign branded the House Select Committee on Benghazi a "sham" after an ex-staffer alleged the Republican-led panel is carrying out a "partisan investigation" targeting the former Secretary of State.
